pros: Nice atmosphere and great Christian values.

pros: Great people and great environment!

pros:
Helping young men & women find their passion. 
Gain experience in working with different personalities (students, staff, and faculty):
cons:
Close-minded 
Salary is not competitive

review_title: Great place to work, not awesome pay
pros:
The community at UMHB is very friendly, helpful, and kind. (for the most part! :)
I loved my department - I would have never left if I hadn't had to move. 
8-5 during the school year, 8-4 during the summer months! 
Amazing PAID vacations; 2 weeks at Christmas, 3 days at Thanksgiving, 1 week at Spring Break PLUS after your first year you get 2 additional weeks! At 5 years 3 WEEKS! You can't beat that!
Friendly Higher-Ups.
I had a great manager!
cons:
My department was not seen as important as others which was belittling at times.
Extra effort doesn't seem to get appreciated (like for raises or bonuses) 
Benefits could be better but they aren't terrible
There is a lot of last minute "emergencies" that you have to deal with when it comes to certain departments and a sense of entitlement that their stuff should always come first (which is tricky to navigate)

review_title: The school maintains a very nice culture, but the pay for adjuncts is dismal.
pros: Co-workers are kind and supportive, and the general campus culture is nice.
cons: The pay is dismal for adjuncts. I was told by a co-worker that there hadn't been a pay increase for adjuncts for 10 years. That means that the wages are in effect 20-30% lower than 10 years ago!

pros: They live their Christian values
cons: The salary is very low

pros: I loved working with students.  The campus was always well cared for.  The staff at the student union were always super and helpful.  Things were close by and it was nice to get out and walk when I had time.
cons: The most frustrating thing about UMHB was they put my work under 3 hats, so while I worked 67 hours I was not a full time employee just 3 part time employees.  It didn't even get me a parking sticker for the parking lot I had to put a piece of paper on the dash.  I felt humiliated not being a real employee and spending so much of my life there.

pros: Amazing Vacation Time, Nice People, Beautiful Campus, Slow Pace, Mostly 8-5, Health Insurance, Overall nice.
cons: Health Insurance could be better, higher ups close ranks and you have no idea what's going on, pay in the "lower" positions could be more competitive, promotions are definitely made by popularity not skill.

review_title: Some programs are good.  There is trouble in the non-humanities areas...
pros: The students are motivated.  They are not the cream of the crop.  But many have drive.  I enjoyed teaching there for many years.
cons: Some faculty and a department chair or two most feel very vulnerable.  They are apparently are

review_title: Difficult place to work unless you are firmly in the Baptist tradition.
pros: Excellent location, emphasis on campus, facility building and enrollment increases, decent benefits package except for health insurance.  Many excellent facilities.  Decent kids.  Some students have significant academic ability.
cons: Micromanaging environment, regular lack of honesty, poor health insurance.  Some poor facilities, but they are scheduled for improvement.  Some students have poor academic ability and the resources and programs are not in place to aid those students in retention, although retention is said to be a priority.  Pretty "student centered"- students are thought to be always right by the administration.

review_title: I enjoyed my experience at UMHB primarily because of the quality of the people who work and go to school there.
pros: The staff are very supportive and the students are polite and respectful. The atmosphere is positive and encouraging. The online system for posting assignments and grades and communicating with students is user friendly. The campus is attractive and small enough to walk around easily. The class size is small enough to have lots of student interaction. The online library access is helpful.
cons: The compensation is too low.

pros: The institution is financially stable and enjoys yearly record enrollments if students. The salaries are reasonable and the benefits are as well.
cons: As in any university some people seem to enjoy politics. But overall, the focus is on the students where it should be.

review_title: A Good Place to Work with Stipulations
pros:
Decent Benefits
Lots of Perks
President makes the effort to know each employee
It's growing fast
cons:
Atmosphere is a judgmental and restrictive
The University is resistant to change, and thus is struggling with it's own growth.

job_title: Periodicals Library Worker in Belton, TX
pros: I loved working with my supervisor. She communicated with me well and was really invested in my life. I worked in the summer as part of work study, but I got to work 32 hours max a week. Loved the job!
cons: It was only a summer job, and i couldn't continue into the rest of the year.

cons: spousal healthcare is not free or reduced its full rate. Lots of politics between sections.
